0: The Le Meridien Hotel Spa is located at the base of St Julians Bay right on the periphery of Sliema
We stayed in room 127 a sea view exec room it was lovely with a great view of the church and bay
We stayed executive sea view room for 4 nights
We had an ocean view room which was large well equipped and a lovely place to stay for 5 nights
After looking at places in the party areas of St Julians Pacevile more NE and also places closer to Valletta we settled for something in the middle Le Meridien at Baluta Bay
The hotel itself is in an excellent location overlooking Baluta bay
Upon check in we were upgraded to a sea view room on the 8th floor
location for center of town nice with good views of sea
We were fortunate to be allocated a delightful suite over looking Baluta Bay
Loved our room on the 10th floor where we could see the ocean
1: It does not have its own beach so I would not necessarily recommend it for the summer
We were supposed to have a sea view
2: I would say that unles you really want to look at the sea do not opt for the more expensive sea view rooms

There was a spacious rooftop pool area with a wonderful view of Baluta Bay and a variety of quite terraced areas which we did not get to use as it was a bit chilly but no doubt lovely in the warmer weather to sit and chill
Rooms are ok but view over car park and very few rooms have a sea view
Our room was pleasant enough in design and layout but had no decorative wow factor unles you count the sea view which was stunning
Arrival was a bit strange as reception is located on a back street 3 levels higher than the Sea front but the Foyer and staff were lovely and we soon found our bearings
and got 20 discount as spg membernot sure any room had genuine sea view ours did not
No beach at alunlike the pics on web and no see view from the room unles you pay extra
My room was on the 7th floor was view on Baluta Bay
The restaurant is neatly divided by curtains to create differently sized bays which means that tables on each side of the curtain can be quite close to each other
